revised_title: Investigating the Relative Capacities of Venous and Arterial Blood for Heat
tldr: John Davy conducts experiments to determine the relative capacities of venous and arterial blood for heat. He compares the cooling rates of equal volumes of venous and arterial blood, as well as their temperatures in different parts of the body. The results suggest that venous blood has a slightly higher capacity for heat than arterial blood.
